reporting_cycle: Secretary-General/Panel of Experts reports: interim by 1 December 2017, final by 1 May 2018, and monthly updates
summary:
The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on South Sudan, determines that the situation in South Sudan continues to threaten international peace and security.

The Council, acting under Article 41 of Chapter VII, decides to:

1. Renew until 31 May 2018 measures imposed by paragraphs 9 and 12 of resolution 2206 (2015), reaffirming provisions of paragraphs 10, 11, 13, 14, and 15 of resolution 2206 (2015) and paragraphs 8, 9, and 10 of resolution 2290 (2016).

2. Extend until 30 June 2018 the mandate of the Panel of Experts as set out in subparagraphs (a), (b), (c), (e), and (f) of paragraph 12 of resolution 2290 (2016), with reporting requirements.

3. Remain seized of the matter.
